name: Dragonborn
description: Dragonborn are a playable race in Baldur's Gate 3. Dragonborn have resistance to a type of energy damage and are able to make deadly breath weapon attacks. These abilities are affected by their Dragonborn subrace.

options.name: Black Dragonborn
options.description: Despite no ancestral links to the mighty creatures, these dragonborn share the charcoal colouration and fizzling, acid breath of black dragons.

grants.name: Draconic Ancestry (Acid)
grants.description: The blood of ancient dragons flow through your veins. You are Resistant to Acid damage.

options.name: Brass Dragonborn
options.description: Despite no ancestral links to the mighty creatures, these dragonborn share the burnished ochre hue and flickering, fiery breath of brass dragons.

grants.name: Draconic Ancestry (Fire)
grants.description: The blood of ancient dragons flow through your veins. You are Resistant to Fire damage.

options.name: Copper Dragonborn
options.description: Despite no ancestral links to the mighty creatures, these dragonborn share the pink-gold colouration and corrosive breath of copper dragons.

grants.name: Draconic Ancestry (Acid)
grants.description: The blood of ancient dragons flow through your veins. You are Resistant to Acid damage.

options.name: Green Dragonborn
options.description: Despite no ancestral links to the mighty creatures, these dragonborn share the brilliant emerald aspect and stinking, putrid breath of green dragons.

grants.name: Draconic Ancestry (Poison)
grants.description: The blood of ancient dragons flow through your veins. You are Resistant to Poison damage.

options.name: Silver Dragonborn
options.description: Despite no ancestral links to the mighty creatures, these dragonborn share the glinting shine and scorching cold breath of silver dragons.

grants.name: Draconic Ancestry (Cold)
grants.description: The blood of ancient dragons flow through your veins. You are Resistant to Cold damage.

name: Drow
description: Drow are the dark elves of the Forgotten Realms. They dwell in the Underdark, large subterranean caverns beneath the surface.

options.name: Lolth-Sworn Drow
options.description: Raised by Lolth's cult in the city of Menzoberranzan, these drow extol the virtues of their corrupt and merciless goddess. Lolth marks her followers with bright red eyes so the Underdark will learn to fear Drow on sight.

options.name: The Cult of Lolth
options.description: The much-reviled matriarch of the drow pantheon, Lolth holds sway over spiders, the Underdark, and the wicked creatures of the Demonweb Pits. Her primary goal is to corrupt all drow, transforming them into heartless cultists.

grants.name: Drow Weapon Training
grants.description: You have Proficiency with the Rapier, Shortsword, and Hand Crossbow.

grants.name: Superior Darkvision
grants.description: Can see in the dark up to 24m.

grants.name: Fey Ancestry
grants.description: The Feywild casts a veil over your mind. You have Advantage on SavingThrows against being Charmed, and magic can't put you to Sleeping|Sleep.

name: Dwarf
description: As durable and unyielding as their homes of stone, dwarves are some of the finest warriors, miners, and smiths of Faer√ªn.

options.name: Gold Dwarves
options.description: Gold Dwarves are known for their confidence and keen intuition. The culture of their Deep Kingdom values family, ritual, and fine craftsmanship.

grants.name: Dwarven Toughness
grants.description: You have 1 extra maximum Hit Points per level.

options.name: Shield Dwarves
options.description: Shield Dwarves survived a long fall from grace, surrendering many of their ancient kingdoms in wars with Goblins and Orcs. These losses have lead to a cynical mindset, yet Shield Dwarves will endure anything to restore their ancestral homelands.

grants.name: Dwarven Armour Training
grants.description: You have Armour Proficiency with Light and Medium Armour.

options.name: Duergar
options.description: Once enslaved by the eldritch Mind Flayers, Duergar adapted to freedom with harsh practicality. Their cold demeanours and gift of stealth are well-known through the Underdark.

grants.name: Superior Darkvision
grants.description: Can see in the dark up to 24m.

grants.name: Duergar Resilience
grants.description: You have Advantage on Saving Throws  against illusions and against being Charmed or Paralysed.

grants.name: Dwarven Combat Training
grants.description: You have Proficiency with the Battleaxe, Handaxe, Light Hammer, and Warhammers.

grants.name: Dwarven Resilience
grants.description: You have Advantage on Saving Throws against being Poisoned, and you have Resistance against Poison damage.

name: Elf
description: With an ethereal countenance and long lifespans, elves are at home with nature's power, flourishing in light and dark alike.

options.name: High Elves
options.description: Heirs of the mystical [https://forgottenrealms.fandom.com/wiki/Feywild Feywild], high elves value magic in all its forms, and even those who do not study spellcraft can manipulate the [https://forgottenrealms.fandom.com/wiki/Weave Weave].

options.name: Wood Elves
options.description: Wood elves spend their reclusive lives in [[Faer√ªn

grants.name: Elven Weapon Training
grants.description: You have Proficiency with the Longsword, Shortsword, Shortbow, and Longbow.

grants.name: Fey Ancestry
grants.description: The Feywild casts a veil over your mind. You have Advantage on SavingThrows against being Charmed, and magic can't put you to Sleeping|Sleep.

name: Githyanki
description: Githyanki are peerless warriors from the mind flayers, whose ancient empire enslaved the ancestral gith for millennia.

grants.name: Martial Prodigy
grants.description: A lifetime of relentless training gave you Armor Proficiency with Light and Medium Armour, as well as Proficiency with the Shortsword, Longsword, and Greatsword.

name: Gnome
description: Small, clever, and energetic, gnomes use their long lives to explore Faer√ªn's brightest corners and darkest depths.

options.name: Rock Gnomes
options.description: The most commonly seen gnome on Faer√ªn's surface, Rock Gnomes are named as such for their hardiness and affinity to metal.

grants.name: Artificer's Lore
grants.description: Add twice your Proficiency Bonus to History checks.

options.name: Forest Gnomes
options.description: Even smaller than their cousins and twice as reclusive, Forest Gnomes are rare sight in Faer√ªn. They master magic and craftmanship in their distant, idyllic groves.

options.name: Deep Gnomes
options.description: More guarded than their surface cousins, Deep Gnomes survive in the Underdark with darkvision and skillful stealth.

grants.name: Superior Darkvision
grants.description: Can see in the dark up to 24m.

grants.name: Stone Camouflage
grants.description: You have Advantage on Stealth checks.

grants.name: Gnome Cunning
grants.description: You have Advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma Saving Throws.

name: Half-Elf
description: Half-Elves inherit blessings from both their parents, but at the price of never quite fitting in. Curious, ambitious, and versatile, half-elves are welcome everywhere, but struggle without a community to call their own.

options.name: High Half-Elves
options.description: A touch of the [https://forgottenrealms.fandom.com/wiki/Feywild Feywild] remains in half-elves with this bloodline, and even those untrained in magic possess a hint of wild power.

options.name: Wood Half-Elves
options.description: Like their wood elf parent, these half-elves have a quickened stride and eye for stealth. Yet many break away from isolation in Faer√ªn's forests to explore the rest of the Realms.

options.name: Drow Half-Elves
options.description: Most Half-Drow result from liaisons between [[Drow#Seldarine Drow

grants.name: Civil Militia
grants.description: You have Weapon Proficiency with spears, pikes, halberds, and glaives, and Armour Proficiency with Light Armour and Shields.

grants.name: Fey Ancestry
grants.description: The Feywild casts a veil over your mind. You have Advantage on SavingThrows against being Charmed, and magic can't put you to Sleeping|Sleep.

name: Half-Orc
description: Half-Orcs exhibit a blend of orcish and human characteristics, and their appearance varies widely. Creatures of intense emotion, Half-Orcs are more inclined to act than contemplate - whether the rage burning their bodies compels them to fight, or the love filling their hearts inspires acts of incredible kindness.

grants.name: Darkvision (Passive Feature)
grants.description: Can see in the dark up to 12m.

grants.name: Savage Attacks
grants.description: When you land a Critical Hit with a melee weapon attack, you deal an extra dice of weapon damage.

name: Halfling
description: Small yet capable, halflings prefer the comforts of home and hearth - but their natural luck and dexterity makes them fine adventurers.

options.name: Lightfoot Halflings
options.description: Lightfoot Halflings are stealthy but social, travelling all over Faer√ªn to make a name for themselves.

grants.name: Naturally Stealthy
grants.description: Your nimble nature makes you skilled at concealment. You have Advantage on Checks.

options.name: Strongheart Halflings
options.description: Legends say dwarven blood gave stronghearts their hardiness. Resistant to poison and wellsprings of endurance, these halflings easily hold their own.

grants.name: Strongheart Resilience
grants.description: You have Advantage on Poison}} and [[Damage_Types#Resistance|Resistance to Poison damage.

grants.name: Halfling Luck
grants.description: When you roll a 1 for an Attack Roll, Ability Check, or Saving Throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

grants.name: Brave
grants.description: You have Advantage on Saving Throws against Frightened.

name: Human
description: The most common face to see in Faer√ªn, humans are known for their tenacity, creativity, and endless capacity for growth.

grants.name: Civil Militia
grants.description: You have Weapon Proficiency with spears, pikes, halberds, and glaives, and Armour Proficiency with Light Armour and Shields.

grants.name: Human Versatility
grants.description: Select an additional Skill to be Proficient in. Your carrying capacity is increased by a quarter.

name: Tiefling
description: Touched by the Hells, Tieflings are resistant to fire and carry extraordinary Infernal powers.

options.name: Asmodeus Tieflings
options.description: Bound to Nessus, the deepest layer of the Hells, these Tieflings inherit the ability to wield fire and darkness from the archdevil Asmodeus' infernal bloodline.

options.name: Mephistopheles Tieflings
options.description: Descended from the archdevil Mephistopheles, these Tieflings are gifted with a particular affinity for arcane magic.

options.name: Zariel Tieflings
options.description: Tieflings from Zariel's bloodlines are empowered with martial strength, and can channel searing flame to punish their enemies.

grants.name: Hellish Resistance
grants.description: Your blood protects you from flame, abyssal or otherwise. Gain Resistance to Fire damage, taking only half damage from it.
